posts.title: The Help
posts.author: Kathryn Stockett
posts.details: Three ordinary women are about to take one extraordinary step. The Help is a timeless and universal story about the lines we abide by, and the ones we don't.

posts.title: The Kite Runner
posts.author: Khaled Hosseini
posts.details: The unforgettable, heartbreaking story of the unlikely friendship between a wealthy boy and the son of his father’s servant, The Kite Runner is a beautifully crafted novel set in a country that is in the process of being destroyed.

posts.title: The Book Thief
posts.author: Markus Zusak
posts.details: By her brother's graveside, Liesel's life is changed when she picks up a single object, partially hidden in the snow. It is The Gravedigger's Handbook, left behind there by accident, and it is her first act of book thievery.

posts.title: Jane Eyre
posts.author: Charlotte Bronte
posts.details: Orphaned as a child, Jane has felt an outcast her whole young life. Her courage is tested once again when she arrives at Thornfield Hall, where she has been hired by the brooding, proud Edward Rochester to care for his ward Adèle. Jane finds herself drawn to his troubled yet kind spirit. She falls in love. Hard.

posts.title: The Great Gatsby
posts.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
posts.details: The story is of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his new love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, of lavish parties on Long Island at a time when The New York Times noted gin was the national drink and sex the national obsession, it is an exquisitely crafted tale of America in the 1920s.

posts.title: Little Woman
posts.author: Louisa May Alcott
posts.details: Here are talented tomboy and author-to-be Jo, tragically frail Beth, beautiful Meg, and romantic, spoiled Amy, united in their devotion to each other and their struggles to survive in New England during the Civil War.
